content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) BARCELONA/LONDON  September 26 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings says ABB Ltd's (A-/Stable) ratings are not affected by the Swiss engineering group's USD2.6 billion acquisition of US-based General Electric Industrial Solutions. Fitch believes ABB's leverage metrics will remain commensurate with the current rating levels  driven by EBIT margins of around 8%-9% and additional cash buffer coming from USD 3 billion share buyback programme being put on
name: ABB Ltd
title: Fitch: No Rating Impact on ABB from GE Industrial Solutions Acquisition

name: ABB Ltd
title: REFILE-ABB chairman says Power Grids unit back in shape

content: ZURICH  April 20 Three shareholder advisory firms oppose plans by ABB to appoint Frederico Fleury Curado to its board  saying his existing positions at listed companies would leave him too little time to devote to the Swiss engineer.
name: ABB Ltd
title: Three shareholder advisory firms oppose ABB board candidate Curado

content: ZURICH  April 21 Shareholders of Swiss electrical engineering group ABB elected Brazilian executive Frederico Fleury Curado to the board of directors on Thursday despite opposition from three shareholder advisory firms.
name: ABB Ltd
title: ABB shareholders elect Curado to board member despite opposition

content: * CEO Ulrich Spiesshofer says aims to get as close as possible to revenue growth targets this year of 3-6 percent growth in local currencies
name: ABB Ltd
title: BRIEF-ABB CEO says Brexit has not hit orders  sticks to growth target

content: * Shares rise 4 percent   (Recasts story to focus on Europe  cost cuts)
name: ABB Ltd
title: UPDATE 2-ABB says Europe demand helping to offset China slump

content: * Chief Executive Officer Ulrich Spiesshofer says does not see changes in China market conditions 'for better or for worse'
name: ABB Ltd
title: BRIEF-ABB CEO says Brazil remains a 'very difficult market'

content: ZURICH  April 20 Power grids maker ABB  said first-quarter net profit fell less than analysts had forecast as the company's automation products and services weathered a slump amid low oil prices and weak demand from China.
name: ABB Ltd
title: ABB Q1 net beats forecast  to make Power Grids review in October

content: ZURICH  March 31 Swiss technology group ABB  has won an order worth more than $250 million from Danish energy company DONG Energy to deliver a high-voltage cable system connecting the Hornsea Project One offshore wind farm in the North Sea to Britain's mainland grid  it said on Thursday.
name: ABB Ltd
title: ABB wins $250 mln order to link offshore wind farm to UK grid

content: BEIJING  March 31 China's biggest power transmission company has signed deals with three Asia-Pacific investors to help push its ambition to build a cross-border energy super grid that will help combat climate change  integrate renewable energy sources and boost exports.
name: ABB Ltd
title: China eyes export opportunities for global super grid

content: ZURICH ABB's  second-biggest shareholder  activist investor Cevian  has hired Boston Consulting Group to study a potential break-up of the Swiss engineering group  turning up the pressure for a revamp  Germany's Manager Magazin reported.
name: ABB Ltd
title: Cevian asks consultant to study potential ABB break-up: Manager Magazin

content: ZURICH  March 16 ABB's second-biggest shareholder  activist investor Cevian  has hired Boston Consulting Group to study a potential break-up of the Swiss engineering group  turning up the pressure for a revamp  Germany's Manager Magazin reported.
name: ABB Ltd
title: CORRECTED-Cevian asks consultant to study potential ABB break-up -Manager Magazin
